question: Malimath Committee report, sometimes seen in news, is related to which of the following?
option1: Establish a coherent data protection framework
option3: Enhance living standards and moderating income inequality
option4: Improving the economic viability of farming
explanation:
The NDA government in year 2000 appointed the Chief Justice of Kerala and Karnataka, Justice V.S. Malimath as the head of the panel formed to suggest an overhaul of the century-old criminal justice system. The committee submitted its report with 158 recommendations. Here are the key recommendations of the committee:
  • It recommended a modification to Article 20 (3) of the Constitution that protects the accused from being compelled to be a witness against himself/herself.
  • It recommended that the courts must be bestowed with powers to summon any person irrespective whether he/she is listed as a witness or not for examination, if it felt necessary.
  • It advocated the participation of victim in cases involving serious crimes and also be given adequate compensation.
  • It recommended setting up a victim compensation fund under the victim compensation law
  • It suggested hiving off the investigation wing from Law and Order and setting up of a National Security Commission and State Security Commissions.
